neighbors.name: Forsberg Farm Trust
neighbors.claims: The Forsberg Farm Trust is a private landholding entity with a mailing address in Clinton, Illinois, care of Roger E. Forsberg ([Saline County Planning Notice](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). The entity was explicitly listed as a notified property owner for the Mountain Peak Energy Storage (Plus Power) project, a battery energy storage system proposed near Assaria, Kansas ([Saline County Planning Notice](https://www.salinecountyks.gov/media/planning-zoning/Conditional%20Use%20Permit%20Application/Mountain%20Peak/Appendix%20L%20through%20R.pdf)). While the Trust itself did not submit public comments, related family member Doug Forsberg (residing at 2652 E Mentor Rd) testified at a Planning Commission meeting in August 2023 regarding the project, expressing concerns about road conditions, blind spots, and traffic safety on Mattison Road ([Planning Commission Minutes](https://pub-salinecounty.escribemeetings.com/filestream.ashx?DocumentId=6338)). Related family entities, such as 'Forsberg Bros,' have been recipients of USDA agricultural subsidies ([EWG Farm Subsidy Database](https://farm.ewg.org/top_recips.php?fips=20169&progcode=tot_dairy&regionname=SalineCounty,Kansas)).
neighbors.influence_justification: The Trust is an absentee owner (Illinois-based) and has not taken a public stance itself, though local family members are active in zoning hearings regarding infrastructure.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact Trustee Roger E. Forsberg in Illinois for formal permissions. Simultaneously, engage local family member Doug Forsberg regarding road use agreements (RUMA) and traffic management plans, as he has a documented history of concern regarding industrial traffic on local roads.

neighbors.profile_summary: Absentee farm trust based in Illinois (Roger E. Forsberg). The Trust was a notified neighbor for the Mountain Peak Battery Storage project. Local family member Doug Forsberg is vocal about road safety and infrastructure impacts from energy/industrial development.
